oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmakinetics of Vancomycin Hydrochloride in the Horse Following Intravenous Infusion
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dreyfuss, D. J.
Orsini, J. A.
Ramberg, C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vancomycin
staphylococcal infection
enterococcal infection
pharmacokinetics
horses
graduate research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vancomycin is used to treat severe staphylococcal and enterococcal infections in humans. Ototoxic and nephrotoxic side effects are potential problems if peak levels exceed 40 mg/L. The pharmacokinetics of vancomycin were determined for serum and synovia of healthy horses given single-dose IV infusions. Five healthy mature horses were used in the study.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 123
